page.title: 04Miserden Estate Farming 2
page.content: Since there is no way of expanding the Estate the Farming must become increasingly intensive;to put more cattle on to less grazing land and grow more crops on free land that has been released from livestock. There is a broad rotation scheme, three years of cereal,two of oil seed rape and then back to cereal again. The Estate has{three large {tractors,two combine harvesters and a {round baler.50 acres can be ploughed {in a day and 140 acres can be drilled {in a day.}This kind of equipment has reduced the labour force quite dramatically. A wide variety of{chemical sprays are used for weed control,fungi and various cereal diseases. Sophisticated sprays are vital for modern farming.
